body.p: The IASB considered making it a requirement to measure non‑controlling interests at fair value unless doing so would impose undue cost or effort on the acquirer. However, feedback from constituents and staff research indicated that it was unlikely that the term undue cost or effort would be applied consistently. Therefore, such a requirement would be unlikely to increase appreciably the consistency with which different entities measured non‑controlling interests.
